pkgmetadata.longdescription: Calculate and Plot Decision Curve // Diagnostic and prognostic models are typically evaluated with measures of accuracy that do not address clinical consequences. Decision-analytic techniques allow assessment of clinical outcomes but often require collection of additional information and may be cumbersome to apply to models that yield a continuous result. Decision curve analysis is a suitable method for evaluating alternative diagnostic and prognostic strategies that has advantages over other commonly used measures and techniques. This method was described by Andrew J. Vickers (2006) doi:10.1177/0272989X06295361.
